ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: PEPPI Total Score
How confident are you in your ability: To get doctors to pay attention to what you have to say?
Notes: 1 = Not at all confident; 5 = Very confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you in your ability: To know what questions to ask doctors?
Notes: 1 = Not at all confident; 5 = Very confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you in your ability: To get doctors to answer all of your questions?
Notes: 1 = Not at all confident; 5 = Very confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you in your ability: To ask doctors questions about your chief health concern?
Notes: 1 = Not at all confident; 5 = Very confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you in your ability: To make the most of your visits with your doctors?
Notes: 1 = Not at all confident; 5 = Very confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you in your ability: To get your doctors to take your chief health concern seriously?
Notes: 1 = Not at all confident; 5 = Very confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you in your ability: To understand what doctors tell you?
Notes: 1 = Not at all confident; 5 = Very confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you in your ability: To get doctors to do something about your chief health concern?
Notes: 1 = Not at all confident; 5 = Very confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you in your ability: To explain your chief health concern to doctors?
Notes: 1 = Not at all confident; 5 = Very confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you in your ability: To ask doctors for more information if you don't understand what he or she said?
Notes: 1 = Not at all confident; 5 = Very confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you in your ability: To know what questions to ask a doctor?
Notes: 0 = Not confident at all; 10 = extremely confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you in your ability: To get a doctor to answer all of your questions?
Notes: 0 = Not confident at all; 10 = extremely confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you in your ability: To make the most of your visits with your doctors?
Notes: 0 = Not confident at all; 10 = extremely confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you in your ability: To get a doctor to take your chief health concern seriously?
Notes: 0 = Not confident at all; 10 = extremely confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you in your ability: To get a doctor to do something about your chief health concern?
Notes: 0 = Not confident at all; 10 = extremely confident
